title: Le président syrien arrive aux Etats-Unis pour une visite inédite
summary: Le président intérimaire syrien, Ahmad al-Chareh, est arrivé aux Etats-Unis samedi pour une visite officielle inédite, a rapporté l'agence de presse officielle de son pays, au lendemain de son retrait de la liste noire américaine du terrorisme.

title: Sécheresse sans précédent en Iran : les réservoirs d'eau presque à sec
summary: Les quatre barrages alimentant Mashhad, deuxième plus grande ville d'Iran, sont pratiquement à sec avec des réserves à moins de 3%, a rapporté dimanche un média local, au moment où le pays fait face à une sécheresse sans précédent. Hamidreza Azari, ingénieur en recherche à l'Université Aix-Marseille, est notre invité.

title: Israël annonce avoir récupéré la dépouille présumée d'un soldat tué en 2014 à Gaza
summary: Israël a annoncé dimanche avoir reçu de la Croix-Rouge la dépouille présumée d'un otage que le Hamas dit être celle du lieutenant Hadar Goldin, tué en 2014 à Gaza. La dépouille aurait été retrouvée la veille "dans un tunnel de Rafah".

title: Le quotidien à Gaza après deux ans de frappes meurtrières menées par Israël
summary: Les dernières images de Gaza en ruines après deux ans de frappes meurtrières menées par Israël.

title: Au Liban, au moins trois morts et plusieurs blessés dans de nouvelles frappes israéliennes
summary: Selon le ministère libanais de la Santé, des frappes israéliennes ont tué samedi trois personnes et fait plusieurs blessés. L'armée israélienne a pour sa part confirmé avoir tué deux personnes présentées comme des "terroristes".

title: Sécheresse inédite en Iran : le gouvernement prévoit des coupures d'eau
summary: Le gouvernement iranien prévoit de couper périodiquement l'eau à Téhéran, métropole de plus de 10 millions d'habitants, afin de limiter la consommation et d'enrayer le "gaspillage", au moment où l'Iran fait face à une sécheresse sans précédent.

title: Sécheresse inédite en Iran : "on craint le pire pour les prochains mois"
summary: L'Iran est confronté cette année à sa pire sécheresse depuis des décennies. À Téhéran, le gouvernement prévoit des coupures pour économiser l'eau. Le président iranien a averti jeudi que Téhéran pourrait devoir être évacuée en raison des pénuries d'eau s'il ne pleut pas d'ici la fin de l'année. Les explications de notre correspondant Siavosh Ghazi à Téhéran.

title: Gaza : les étudiants gazaouis de l'Université Al-Aqsa diplomés malgré les bombes
summary: Malgré la précarité de la trêve et les conditions de vie extrêmement difficiles à Gaza, une promotion d’étudiants palestiniens a été diplômée à l'Université Al-Aqsa.

title: Gaza : le corps remis vendredi à Israël identifié comme celui d'un otage israélo-argentin
summary: L'armée israélienne a annoncé samedi que la dépouille remise la veille par le Hamas et le Jihad islamique à Gaza était celle de Lior Rudaeff, un Israélo-Argentin tué et enlevé le 7 octobre 2023. Chauffeur d'ambulance bénévole, il avait tenté de défendre son kibboutz avec quatre autres habitants lors de l'attaque du Hamas.

title: Libération de Cécile Kohler et Jacques Paris : diplomatie ou chantage ?

title: L'armée israélienne annonce que la Croix-Rouge a réceptionné la dépouille d'un otage à Gaza
summary: Un des derniers corps d'otages encore retenus à Gaza a été réceptionné par la Croix-Rouge à l'État hébreu dans la soirée, a annoncé vendredi l'armée israélienne. Sur les 28 personnes concernées, 22 dépouilles ont été rendues à Israël. Les six dernières sont celles de cinq Israéliens et d'un Thaïlandais.

title: Jean-François Bayart, sociologue : « Les idéaux politiques de la génération Z sont très ambivalents, et facilement récupérables »
summary: Le sociologue français explique, dans un entretien au « Monde », en quoi la vague récente de mobilisation de la jeunesse est une réaction à la révolution conservatrice, mélange d’autoritarisme et de prédation économique, à laquelle cèdent de nombreux Etats. Il relève qu’elle n’est pas exempte pour autant d’ambiguïtés idéologiques.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : Kiev décrit la récente attaque russe comme « l’une des plus graves pour le secteur énergétique depuis le début de la guerre »
summary: L’attaque de samedi a impliqué plus de 450 drones et 45 missiles, selon le vice-ministre de l’énergie ukrainien, Artem Nekrassov. « Une partie très importante de la production a été touchée », a-t-il ajouté, qualifiant la situation sur le réseau de « difficile ».

title: En Suède, les communes défient le gouvernement sur l’aide au retour volontaire des immigrés
summary: Partout dans le pays nordique, des maires manifestent leur opposition à la volonté de la droite et de l’extrême droite d’encourager les immigrés à quitter le pays. Ce mouvement inédit prend le gouvernement au dépourvu.

title: EN DIRECT, Gaza : Israël s’oppose à la présence de soldats turcs au sein de la force internationale de stabilisation
summary: Cette force est prévue dans l’accord qui a conduit à un cessez-le-feu le 10 octobre. Selon les termes de cet accord, il s’agira d’une coalition en majorité composée de pays arabes et musulmans, et déployée pour superviser la sécurité à mesure que l’armée israélienne se retirera. La porte-parole du gouvernement israélien a dit, dimanche, qu’« il n’y aura pas de soldats turcs sur le terrain ».

title: Le Collège de France annule un colloque sur la Palestine « en réaction à la polémique entourant » l’événement
summary: Le Collège de France « ne prône, ni n’encourage, ni ne soutient aucune forme de militantisme », a affirmé l’établissement qui assure de sa « stricte neutralité (…) au regard des questions de nature politique ou idéologique ».

title: « L’inaction de Paris face au meurtre par un drone russe d’Antoni Lallican, journaliste français, étonne et interroge »
summary: Le 3 octobre, un drone russe a tué, en Ukraine, le photoreporter de 37 ans. Sa compagne, Aïda Belloulid, déplore, dans une tribune au « Monde », l’absence de réponse forte de Paris pour obtenir des explications de Moscou. Il en va de la sécurité des journalistes.

title: L’Iran confronté à une sécheresse sans précédent

title: Donald Trump et son utilisation de l’IA : une communication ordurière qui insensibilise à la violence politique
summary: Le recours aux visuels de mauvais goût générés par intelligence artificielle est désormais devenu la norme pour le président des Etats-Unis et son administration.

title: Enhanced Games : « Les lois du marché poussent les athlètes à prendre tous les risques possibles pour être vainqueur »
summary: Dans une tribune au « Monde », le professeur d’éducation physique et sportive Maxime Scotti s’inquiète de la tenue des Enhanced Games en 2026 aux Etats-Unis, une compétition sportive qui autorise et encourage le dopage. Il y voit une « porte ouverte à toutes les excentricités », et une grave mise en danger des athlètes au nom du triomphe de la performance.

title: Ireland joins calls to ban Israel from European football
summary:
Ireland joins calls to ban Israel from European football

Submitted by MEE staff on Sun, 11/09/2025 - 15:09
The Irish Football Association says Israel broke Uefa rules by allowing 'settlement clubs' in the occupied West Bank
A demonstrator wearing a t-shirt reading "Red card for Israel" chained himself to the goal post prior to the Uefa Women's Euro 2025 qualifying match between Scotland and Israel at Hampden Park stadium in Glasgow, Scotland, 31 May 2024 (AFP)
Off

Ireland has joined a growing number of countries calling for Israel to be banned from European club and international football competitions.

Late on Saturday, the Football Association of Ireland (FAI) approved a motion to submit a formal resolution to Uefa, urging the suspension of Israeli clubs and the national team from all European football.

The move followed a proposal from Dublin club Bohemians, which argued that the Israel Football Association (IFA) has breached Uefa rules by failing to uphold anti-racism policies and by allowing the establishment of "clubs in illegal settlements in the occupied West Bank" without the consent of the Palestinian Football Association.

During the FAI's meeting, 74 members voted in favour of the motion, with seven against and two abstentions. The association later confirmed the outcome in a statement to Irish media.

"[The FAI will] submit a formal motion to the Uefa executive committee requesting the immediate suspension of the Israel Football Association from Uefa competitions due to its violation of two independent provisions of the Uefa statutes," the statement read.

Ireland's resolution comes amid similar calls from other Uefa member nations, including Norway and Turkey, to ban Israel from European competitions.

Both countries have cited a UN Commission of Inquiry report that concluded Israel had committed genocide during its war on Gaza.

In September, Uefa postponed discussions on banning Israel following the announcement of a ceasefire plan between Israel and Hamas brokered by US President Donald Trump.

At the time, media reports suggested that an extraordinary meeting of Uefa's executive committee was imminent before Trump's intervention.

If Uefa were to vote in favour of banning Israel, it would put the European football body on a collision course with the United States, which is co-hosting the 2026 World Cup.

However, any European ban would not prevent Israel from competing in World Cup qualifiers, which are overseen by Fifa.

Israel's genocide in Gaza

title: Israeli captive's coffin handed to Israeli forces awaiting forensic confirmation
summary:
Israeli captive's coffin handed to Israeli forces awaiting forensic confirmation

Israel has confirmed that the remains of a captive held in Gaza has been handed over to Israeli forces in Gaza.

The captive, who has not been identified, was handed over to the Israelis via the Red Cross, and awaiting forensic confirmation. 

Israel has received, via the Red Cross, the coffin of a fallen hostage, which was handed over to an IDF and ISA force inside the Gaza Strip. From there it will be transferred to Israel, where it will be received in a military ceremony with the participation of the IDF Chief Rabbi

title: Israel says 'no Turkish boots on the ground' in Gaza
summary:
Israel says 'no Turkish boots on the ground' in Gaza

An Israeli government spokesperson said on Sunday that Turkish soldiers will not be part of the multinational force expected to take over Gaza from the Israeli military. 

"There will be no Turkish boots on the ground," said Israeli spokesperson Shosh Bedrosian, in response to a question about the multinational force.

title: 241 Palestinians killed in Gaza since ceasefire: Health Ministry
summary:
241 Palestinians killed in Gaza since ceasefire: Health Ministry

The Palestinian health ministry said that Israeli strikes in Gaza have killed one person and injured five others in the past 24 hours. 

Health officials said they recovered six bodies, which were brought to hospital, after civil defence workers found them underneath the rubble.

"A number of victims remain under the rubble and in the streets, as ambulance and civil defence teams are unable to reach them at this time," the health ministry said. 

The ministry added that since the ceasefire came into effect, 241 people have been killed and 619 wounded, with 528 bodies recovered.

title: UK: Fifth Palestine Action prisoner joins rolling hunger strike over detention conditions
summary:
UK: Fifth Palestine Action prisoner joins rolling hunger strike over detention conditions

Submitted by Katherine Hearst on Fri, 11/07/2025 - 12:16
T Hoxha previously went on strike over tightening restrictions in the aftermath of the group's proscription
T Hoxha, one of the "Filton 24", has been on remand since November 2024, awaiting her trial which will start in April 2026 (supplied)
Off

A fifth Palestine Action-affiliated prisoner has launched a hunger strike over her detention conditions and the UK government's ban on the direct action group.

The 29-year-old prisoner, named T Hoxha, has joined four other prisoners in a rolling hunger strike launched on 2 November over what they describe as "systematic abuse" by the prison authorities.

Qesser Zurah and Amu Gibb, prisoners currently held at HMP Bronzefield, launched their strikes on Sunday. Heba Muraisi, who is held at HMP New Hall, joined on Monday, and Jon Cink, also held at Bronzefield, refused food on Thursday.

Hoxha is one of the "Filton 24" - activists from the recently proscribed direct action group Palestine Action who were arrested on terrorism charges.

Those charges were in connection with an action in August 2024, when six activists drove a modified van into the research and development hub of the UK facility of Israeli arms company, Elbit Systems, in Filton, Bristol.

Currently held at HMP Peterborough, Hoxha has been on remand since November 2024, awaiting her trial which will start in April 2026.

This is the second hunger strike Hoxha has observed within the last three months.

In August, she refused food for three weeks over worsening treatment by prison staff in the aftermath of the government's move to ban the group under terrorism legislation in July.

The campaign group Prisoners for Palestine (PFP) announced the launch of the rolling hunger strike after Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood failed to respond to a letter outlining their demands, including immediate bail and an end to prison interference with their personal communications, as well as the de-proscription of Palestine Action.

More are expected to participate in the coming weeks.

'I will persevere'

The prisoners have received widespread support from pro-Palestine activists.

Former Lebanese political prisoner Georges Abdallah - freed in July after 41 years in a French jail - sent a message to the hunger strikers, expressing his “full solidarity with the Comrades of ‘Prisoners for Palestine’” in the face of “repression”.

Israel's war on Gaza: Who are Palestine Action?
Read More »

From house arrest, US activist Jakhi McCray, who is accused of torching police vehicles, said he will also begin a hunger strike in solidarity and to draw attention to their case.

In his letter, McCray wrote: “These comrades have been physically isolated even within their prisons, banned from communicating with family and friends, assaulted, denied a fair trial, and harassed over their religion.”

Zurah, Gibb and Muraisi reported that they have been repeatedly denied medical attention and refused requests for electrolytes. One of the prisoners has now gone a week without food.

PFP said the government has still not issued a response to their letter nor commented on the strikers.

"I am astounded by T's resilience in joining her comrades in this hunger strike, having just completed one two months ago," PFP's Audrey Corno said. 

"In our last visit, she told me: 'Don't worry about me. I've read about Guantanamo, and I am embarrassed - I will do this hunger strike in comparative comfort. Whatever happens to me cannot compare to the scenes in Palestine. Therefore I will persevere.'"

"This is the strength the British state is up against," Corno added.

title: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz bans army officers from briefing journalists without his approval
summary:
Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz bans army officers from briefing journalists without his approval

Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz banned army officers from briefing journalists without his direct permission, according to Israeli media reports.

Katz reportedly instructed army spokesperson Brigadier General Effie Defrin to stop all interviews and briefings by senior commanders to journalists.

Katz also instructed Defrin to seek his approval for every media briefing or update in a reversal of long-standing practice.

Under the new directive, Katz must be informed who the journalist requesting the meeting is, which officer will conduct the briefing and what topics will be discussed.

The only exception to Katz's new directive is the Israeli army spokesperson, who is authorised to speak with reporters and the public without prior ministerial approval. 

Earlier, military sources told Haaretz that Katz reprimanded Defrin for failing to inform him on conversations held between senior officers and journalists.

title: Hezbollah says its fighter killed in Israel drone strike
summary:
Hezbollah says its fighter killed in Israel drone strike

Hezbollah confirmed that an Israeli drone strike killed one of its fighters, Hassan Ali Jamil Sultan, in southern Lebanon on Sunday. 

Earlier, Lebanon's health ministry said one person was killed in the attack that targeted a vehicle.

Over the last few days, southern Lebanon has come under increased Israeli attack.

title: Hamas fighters holed up in Rafah vow to not surrender
summary:
Hamas fighters holed up in Rafah vow to not surrender

Hamas fighters holed up in the Israeli-held Rafah area of Gaza will not surrender to Israel, the group's armed wing said on Sunday, urging mediators to find a solution to a crisis that threatens the month-old ceasefire.

Sources close to mediation efforts told Reuters on Thursday that fighters could surrender their arms in exchange for passage to other areas of the enclave under a proposal aimed at resolving the stalemate.

Egyptian mediators have proposed that, in exchange for safe passage, fighters still in Rafah surrender their arms to Egypt and give details of tunnels there so they can be destroyed, one of the sources, an Egyptian security official, said.

Sunday's statement from the Qassam Brigades held Israel responsible for engaging the fighters, who it said were defending themselves.

"The enemy must know that the concept of surrender and handing oneself over does not exist in the dictionary of the Qassam Brigades," the group said.

US special envoy Steve Witkoff said on Thursday that the proposed deal for about 200 fighters would be a test for a broader process to disarm Hamas forces across Gaza.

The Qassam Brigades did not comment directly on the continuing talks over the fighters in Rafah but implied that the crisis could affect the ceasefire.

"We place the mediators before their responsibilities, and they must find a solution to ensure the continuation of the ceasefire and prevent the enemy from using flimsy pretexts to violate it and exploit the situation to target innocent civilians in Gaza," the group said.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning,

Here is a recap of the latest developments: 

  • Hamas said it will return the body of Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin, who was captured and killed in Gaza since 2014. 
  • The Palestinian foreign ministry praised Turkey's decision to issue arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Defence Minister Israel Katz. 
  • Israeli settlers wounded seven Palestinians in two separate attacks in the occupied West Bank on Sunday. 
  • Lebanon's health ministry said that recent Israeli bombardment of southern Lebanon has killed at least two people. 
  • An Israeli drone attack has killed a Palestinian in the town of Bani Suheila, in southern Gaza.

title: Hamas to return body of Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin
summary:
Hamas to return body of Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin

The military wing of Hamas said it will return the body of Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin to Israel at 2PM local time as part of US President Donald Trump's ceasefire deal.

The Qassam Brigades said that it found Goldin's body on Saturday afternoon in a tunnel in the Yebna camp in Rafah, southern Gaza.

Hamas captured Goldin and reported him killed during an Israeli offensive in the Gaza Strip in 2014. He is one of the five remaining meant to be returned to Israel under the current ceasefire deal.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • British Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper on Saturday called for all aid routes to Gaza to be opened and for aid restrictions to be lifted immediately.

  • The Palestinian Health Ministry has reported that the death toll in Gaza has risen to 69,169 Palestinians since October 2023, after more dead bodies were found in the debris. 

  • Turkey has issued arrest warrants for genocide against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and senior officials in his government over the war on Gaza.

  • The Israeli military is preparing to receive the body of a deceased captive soldier from the Gaza Strip, Haaretz reported..

  • Israeli military forces killed a Palestinian man during a raid in Far’a refugee camp, south of Tubas in the occupied West Bank.

  • Israeli settlers attacked a group of Palestinian villagers, activists and journalists on Saturday who had gathered during an attempt to harvest olives near a settler outpost in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, witnesses said.

  • A Palestinian child was killed after an explosive device left behind by Israeli forces in the city of Khan Younis detonated, Al Jazeera reported, citing Nasser Hospital.

  • The Israeli military says it shot at two people, one fatally, claiming that they crossed the yellow line and approached Israeli soldiers operating in northern Gaza.

  • The World Health Organization has called for the Rafah crossing between Gaza and Egypt to be reopened for urgent medical evacuations of 16,500 Palestinian patients in Gaza.

title: UK foreign minister urges Israeli aid blockade on Gaza to be lifted
summary:
UK foreign minister urges Israeli aid blockade on Gaza to be lifted

British Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper on Saturday called for all aid routes to Gaza to be opened and for aid restrictions to be lifted immediately.

In a post on X, Cooper said in Jordan last week she saw "warehouses full of aid still waiting to get into Gaza even though families are still going hungry."

In Jordan last week I saw warehouses full of aid still waiting to get into Gaza even though families are still going hungry.

All aid routes must be opened and aid restrictions lifted now. pic.twitter.com/zNJGSsSOnV

— Yvette Cooper (@YvetteCooperMP) November 8, 2025

title: What is happening in Sudan? Who is responsible for the crimes?
Manchester City vs. Liverpool preview: Team news, lineups and stats
summary: Full preview of Manchester City vs Liverpool: kick‑off time, venue, team news, probable lineups, key stats, managers’ quotes and tactical analysis — read more in our full news report.

title: US unilateral sanctions ‘systematic violation of human rights,’ Iranian official says
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Director-General for Women and Human Rights at Iran’s Foreign Ministry, Forouzandeh Vadiati, has described the United States’ unilateral sanctions against Iran as a “systematic violation of human rights.”

title: Iran and Turkmenistan seek to develop comprehensive bilateral relations
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Deputy Foreign Minister for Economic Affairs, Hamid Ghanbari, who is accompanying a delegation to Turkmenistan, has held talks with top officials there aimed at strengthening bilateral cooperation between the two countries.

title: Iran expands tourism diplomacy in Riyadh meetings
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Minister of Cultural Heritage, Tourism, and Handicrafts Seyed Reza Salehi-Amiri held separate meetings on Sunday with senior officials from several countries, including Indonesia, China, India, Iraq, Tajikistan, Armenia, and Uzbekistan, to discuss ways to expand bilateral cooperation in tourism.

title: Eight countries after arresting Israeli PM
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Eight countries have expressed their readiness to arrest the Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu due to his war crimes in the Gaza Strip.

title: Hezbollah says it doesn’t ask for permission to defend Lebanon
summary: The Lebanese Hezbollah Movement has stressed that it does not need permission to defend Lebanon.

title: Second day of Riyadh 2025 Islamic Solidarity Games
summary: On the second day of the Riyadh 2025 Islamic Solidarity Games on Saturday, Iranian and other athletes competed in swimming events, while Iran’s men’s futsal team defeated Tajikistan 4–1 in their third group-stage match at Green Hall.

title: Yemen warns of resumed strikes should Israel renew Gaza war
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – The chief of staff of Yemeni armed forces warned the Zionists that if they resume the war in Gaza, the Yemenis will return to the battlefield by carrying out military operations.

title: Army Gen. sheds light on first hours of 12-day Israeli war
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – A senior Iranian general says that while the Iranian armed forces were taken by surprise in the first 12 hours in the June aggression, they responded powerfully to the aggression for 12 days to make the aggressor surrender.

title: Iran, Russia emphasize expansion of academic, scientific ties
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – Iranian and Russian officials discussed the importance of deepening scientific, academic, and technological cooperation between universities and research institutions.

title: Iraqi security forces begin special voting in parl. elections
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – Iraqi security and military personnel, including the Popular Mobilization Forces and Peshmerga, begin special voting in the 2025 parliamentary elections.

title: Zanjan to host Iran-Turkey trade and investment exhibition
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – The Director General of Industry, Mine, and Trade of Zanjan Province announced that the Iran-Turkey International Trade and Investment Exhibition will be held in Zanjan Province later this year.

title: US-Israeli-Saudi spy network sought to end support for Gaza
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – Chairman of Yemen’s Supreme Political Council has a spy network tied to US, Israeli, and Saudi intelligence agencies, which was dismantled recently, sought to pull the plug on the Sana’a government for Palestinians in Gaza.

title: Syria's HTS regime ruler arrives in US for Trump talks
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – Syrian ruler Ahmed Sharaa, previously known as Abu Mohammad Jolani has arrived in Washington for an official visit, just two days after the US formally revoked his status as a Specially Designated Global Terrorist.

title: Iran's crude oil exports to China hit new record high: report
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – TankerTrackers has announced that the Iranian oil exports to China have hit new record high since May 2018 when the United States withdrew from the 2015 nuclear deal known as the JCPOA and re-imposition of the sanctions.

title: Iran, Taliban FMs discuss regional tensions
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – Afghanistan’s acting foreign minister, Amir Khan Muttaqi, told the Iranian Foreign Minister during a phone call that Kabul remains committed to resolving its differences with Pakistan through diplomacy and dialogue.

title: Death toll from Typhoon Kalmaegi in Philippines climbs to 224
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – The number of fatalities caused by Typhoon Kalmaegi in the Philippines has risen from 188 to 224.

title: Iranian Documentary “Two Sisters” shines in Japan
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – The Iranian documentary “Two Sisters”, produced by Yaser Talebi and Setareh Zare, and directed by Farahbakhsh Farahdinia, has won the Al Jazeera Documentary Channel Co-Production Award at the Tokyo Docs 2025 in Japan.

title: Fire kills six at Turkish perfume warehouse
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – Five other people were injured, one of them seriously, and the owner of the warehouse was among three people arrested in the aftermath of the fire, officials said.

title: نیکرو: شهر بم آماده میزبانی از جشنواره‌های بزرگ گردشگری است
summary: بم- مدیر کل میراث‌فرهنگی استان کرمان گفت: شهرستان بم با ظرفیت‌های گسترده فرهنگی و تاریخی، آمادگی برگزاری رویدادهای مهم گردشگری از جمله جشنواره بین‌المللی غذا و موزه گردشگر است.

title: دعوت از ثابتی برای بررسی اسناد سفر برزیل در سازمان محیط زیست
summary: رئیس سازمان حفاظت محیط زیست از نماینده مجلس که گفته بود انصاری برای سفر کاری به برزیل درخواست ۵۰ میلیارد تومان پول کرده، خواست برای بررسی اسناد این سفر به سازمان محیط زیست برود.

title: توافق ⁧ایران ⁩و ⁧روسیه⁩ برای تشکیل نخستین ⁧کنسرسیوم⁩ حمل‌ونقل دریایی
summary: سفیر ایران در روسیه از توافق ⁧تهران و مسکو برای تشکیل نخستین ⁧کنسرسیوم⁩ حمل‌ونقل دریایی مشترک خبر داد.

title: بسته جامع مقابله با آلودگی هوای خوزستان در ۳ بازه زمانی تصویب شد
summary: اهواز - در جلسه اضطراری شورای هماهنگی مدیریت بحران خوزستان، بسته جامع مقابله با آلودگی هوا در سه بازه زمانی کوتاه‌مدت، میان‌مدت و بلندمدت تصویب شد.

title: اعتراض استقلال به زمان دیدار با پرسپولیس/ امیدوارم کارشان تکرار نشود!
summary: مدیر تیم فوتبال استقلال با انتقاد از برنامه ریزی سازمان لیگ به زمان کم استراحت این تیم نسبت به رقیب سنتی گفت: ما برای دربی دو روز کمتر از پرسپولیس استراحت می کنیم.

title: صنایع بزرگ خوزستان باید ملزم به احداث نیروگاه برق شوند
summary: اهواز - سرپرست اداره کل صنعت، معدن و تجارت خوزستان گفت: صنایع بزرگ باید در بازه سه تا پنج ساله ملزم به احداث نیروگاه شوند تا برق آزادشده به مصرف بخش خصوصی برسد.
